snippet: Only a fraction of the anticipated beneficiaries have applied for compensation, raising questions ahead of the June 15 deadline about whether ample time has been provided to ask for help.
abstract: Kenneth R Feinberg, administrator of fund for victims of Boston Marathon bombings, is resisting calls to extend deadline, despite fact that only a fraction of anticipated beneficiaries have applied for compensation; lawyers are raising questions about whether ample time has been provided to ask for help.
lead_paragraph: Only a fraction of the anticipated beneficiaries have applied for compensation, raising questions ahead of the June 15 deadline about whether ample time has been provided to ask for help.

headline.main: Chief of Boston Marathon Bombing Fund Stands Firm on Deadline
headline.print_headline: Chief of Bombing Fund Stands Firm on Deadline
